title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22 ยง 1023.4 - Additional psychiatric, psychological, medical or expert opinion
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22 ยง 1023.4 - Additional psychiatric, psychological, medical or expert opinion

State Regulations
(a) Pursuant to Judiciary Law section 35 or any other statute, rule or regulation
providing for additional opinion the director shall assist in obtaining, through a panel or otherwise, such additional opinion. (b) No psychiatrist, psychologist, physician or other expert shall be appointed by the court if he
or she is disqualified under provisions of the Mental Hygiene Law or if he or
she is employed at the institution in which the patient is hospitalized or
residing or to which the patient may be transferred as a result of the
proceeding in which the expert is to render his or her opinion. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22
ยง
1023.4

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
